repnme.cdata!:
Cote d'Ivoire - Implementation
            Completion and Result Report on the Economic Governance and
            Recovery Grant Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Implementation
            Completion and Result Report on the Economic Governance and
            Recovery Grant (EGRG) Project for Cote d'Ivoire were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was satisfactory, Bank performance was satisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: given the capacity bottlenecks in the
            country and the fragile and politically complex
            post-conflict situation, it is necessary to ensure that a
            development policy operation is accompanied by appropriately
            targeted technical assistance to ensure that the commitment
            and willingness lead to reform results. In this case, the
            EGRG was supported by Governance and Institutional
            Development Technical Assistance (TA) Project and a
            Low-Income Country Under Stress (LICUS) Trust Fund. In such
            post-conflict situations, it is particularly important to
            select a focused number of prior actions that are deemed
            essential to supporting the government's broader reform
            program. Such selectivity and coordination not only reduces
            the transaction costs for the government that is burdened by
            multiple management demands while the capacity is weak, but
            it also increases the likelihood that such focused actions
            are implemented and the reform program is moved forward.
            Given the risks and complexity of this operation in the
            country's context, close coordination with other
            development partners has been indispensable to mitigate
            risks, realize synergies, and improve the leverage in the
            policy dialogue. Collaboration with the International
            Monetary Fund (IMF) was particularly important.

            Completion and Result Report on the Economic Governance and
            Recovery Grant Project

9437165.majtheme: Public sector governance,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Cote d'Ivoire - Economic Governance
            and Recovery Grant Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Economic
            Governance and Recovery Grant (EGRG) are to: (i) facilitate
            the clearance of Cote d'Ivoire arrears to International
            Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) and
            International Development Association (IDA), which is
            required to restore normal relations between the country and
            the World Bank; and (ii) support Cote d'Ivoire in its
            post-conflict economic and social recovery. Given the
            complex post-conflict environment and governance and
            transparency issues facing the government, this second
            objective is pursued by supporting government-owned reforms
            to improve governance, transparency and efficiency in public
            expenditure management as well as advance structural reforms
            aimed at strengthening governance and transparency in the
            key sectors of the economy (energy, cocoa and financial
            sector). The Government recognizes the crucial importance of
            economic governance and transparency and is committed to
            implement policy reforms to strengthen fiscal
            sustainability, improve private sector confidence and
            enhance transparency of state institutions and processes --
            critical elements for the country's economic and social
            recovery and for stability and stronger growth in the sub-region.
